origination.corpname: University of Michigan. School of Natural Resources and Environment.

did.unittitle: School of Natural Resources and Environment (University of Michigan) publications 1903-2011
did.abstract: Includes annual reports, bibliographies, brochures, bulletins or college catalogs, directories, histories, manuals, newsletters, programs, reports, and surveys. Also contains annual reports, brochures, directories, histories, manuals, newsletters and reports from the Biological Station, Michigan Sea Grant Program, and the Wildland Management Center; as well as newsletters from the Dept. of Forestry and Dept. of Wood Technology and manuals and proposals from ENACT (Environmental Action for Survival). In addition there are by-laws, newsletters, programs, and the yearbooks entitled "Michigan Forester" from the Forestry Club, the Foresters Club, and the Foresters Association. There are also several editions of alumni directories, as well as student publications.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Publications are received periodically from the unit.

accessrestrict.p: The publications are open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., School of Natural Resources and Environment (University of Michigan) Publications, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: See the historical sketch in the finding aid for the School of Natural Resources and Environment (University of Michigan) records.

scopecontent.p: The Publications of the School of Natural Resources and Environment are divided into four series: Unit Publications, Sub-Unit Publications, Topical Publications and Student Publications. Some publications (or their successors) may no longer be available in print but are available on the school s website.

scopecontent.p: Unit Publications include bulletins, directories, and several newsletters, among which are News, whose title changed to Natural Resource News in 1987 and SNRE News in 1995. A college history will also be found here.

scopecontent.p: Sub-Unit Publications consist of materials produced by units within the School of Natural Resources. These include the Alumni Society, the Association of Michigan Foresters, Biological Station, the Center for Strategic Wildlife Management, the Departments of Conservation, Fisheries, Forestry, Wildlife Management and Wood Technology, ENACT (Environmental Action for Survival), Environmental Education Program, Foresters Association, The Forestry Club (whose name changes to the Foresters Club), the International Seminar on Forest Administration and Management, the Meeman Archive, Natural Resource Sociology Lab, Project for the Study of Natural Resources and Environmental Conflict, the Student Policy Advisory Committee, Urban and Regional Planning Ph.D. Program and the Wildland Management Center. The publication Michigan Forester, which was first produced by the Forestry Club and later the Foresters Club, began as a newsletter and gradually evolved into the yearbook of the School of Natural Resources. This publication was replaced by The Source.

scopecontent.p: Topical Publications include materials relating to Alumni of the School of Natural Resources.

did.unittitle: Directory of Alumni and Former Students 1949-1951
Directory of Alumni, Former Students and Faculty 1961

scopecontent.p: Student Publications are printed materials produced by students of the School of Natural Resources. These include newsletters such as Au Naturel, Natural Resources Review, The Resource, SNR Reporter, Synergy and Timber Cruiser.

did.unittitle: The Resource: A Newsletter for People in the School of Natural Resources, v. 1, 1978
Synergy: Literary Journal of the School of Natural Resources, 1983-1984

scopecontent.p: The Website series documents the academic programs, accomplishments, resources, events, and people at the School of Natural Resources and Environment. Content includes important news and announcements, publications (such as newsletters and course catalogs), and information about admissions, curriculum, degree requirements, faculty, and the overall mission of the School. The website series is arranged chronologically and includes content captured by the Internet Archive starting in 1997 as well as captures provided by Bentley Library archivists in 2002, 2004, and 2008. Starting in 2010, this archived website will be captured on a regular, ongoing basis as part of the University of Michigan Web Archives, hosted at http://webarchives.cdlib.org/a/universityofmichigan/.

odd.p: (These versions were preserved by the Internet Archive and are made available through its Wayback Machine. The Bentley Historical Library is not involved in the collection or maintenance of this material.)
